title: Sphere - 1986 - Pumpkins Delight (Live At Umbria Jazz) (1993) FL
description:
Sphere - 1986 - Pumpkins Delight (Live At Umbria Jazz) (1993)

This 1986 concert by the quartet Sphere is one of the short-lived group's high points, although it was not released until five years after the group had disbanded (in 1988) just prior to the death of Charlie Rouse. "Pumpkin's Delight" is a turbocharged blues by Rouse that kicks off the concert with a flourish. Kenny Barron's "Saud's Song" is another up-tempo cooker, an inventive post-bop vehicle that demonstrates why Barron became one of the most in demand pianists for recording sessions during the decade, as well as showcasing a potent opening solo by Rouse. Bassist Buster Williams composed the remaining three tracks. "Christina" is a pretty ballad, while "Tokudo" is a tricky bop chart and "Decaptkon" ranks as one of the more challenging works in the quartet's repertoire; it features Ben Riley's crisp brushwork and a fine solo by its composer. Recommended. (AllMusic)

Track list:
01 - Pumpkin's Delight
02 - Tokudo
03 - Saud's Song
04 - Christina
05 - Deceptakon

Personnel:
BEN RILEY, Drums
KENNY BARRON, Piano
BUSTER WILLIAMS, Bass
CHARLIE ROUSE, Tenor Saxophone.

Enjoy and share!
